intro: Conyza obscura, commonly known as white dandelion, is an annual flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Conyza obscura is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common weed in agricultural areas.
